subject: Critical Thinking
title: Why Fallacies Are So Persuasive
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why Fallacies Are So Persuasive.

hook.text: Fallacies survive because they work. A politician who uses them wins more votes than one who uses pure logic.

buildup.text: Our brains are wired for quick pattern-matching, not careful logic. Fallacies exploit those shortcuts.

discovery.text: Many fallacies piggyback on emotions ‚Äî fear, pride, anger, belonging. Emotion reaches the brain faster than reason.

twist.text: Even knowing about fallacies doesn't make you immune.

climax.text: The best defense isn't spotting fallacies in real-time ‚Äì it's slowing down & asking: 'Does this evidence actually.

punchline.text: Fallacies feel like logic. That's the whole point.

quiz.question: Why do people fall for fallacies even when trained in logic?
options: Fallacies exploit fast emotional processing that bypasses careful reasoning
